thread.title: Kenya’s white farmers besieged by tribal raiders as violence destroys livelihoods – and decades of conservation work
thread.title_full: Kenya’s white farmers besieged by tribal raiders as violence destroys livelihoods – and decades of conservation work

author: Adrian Blomfield
title: Kenya’s white farmers besieged by tribal raiders as violence destroys livelihoods – and decades of conservation work
text:
A drunken warrior, tarrying too long in a town speakeasy, let the plan slip: The next invasions were to begin the following day.
For the white farmers along the banks of the Ewaso Narok, which flows sluggishly across the Laikipia plateau towards Kenya’s northern frontier, this was the warning they had been expecting.
Some of their ranches had already come under attack. Leaving their tribal heartlands to the east and north, armed Samburu herders and their cattle had forced their way onto two of the ranches in this part of Laikipia in recent weeks, damaging property and devastating pasture.
Allegedly goaded by politicians to seize the great ranches of Laikipia, the warriors have brought death and destruction elsewhere in the region, threatening not just farming but the future of one of Africa’s most important areas of wildlife conservation.
To the north of the Ewaso Narok ranches, the carcasses...
